We need this config to be able to control the snapshot trigger from Ratis side for testing purposes. For some tests (TestOzoneManagerHA, OM HA robot tests) we need to set a lower value for auto trigger threshold so that logs can be purged which in turn can instantiate install snapshots.
We can keep it as an internal config and not expose it to users.
Yes. agreed done.
Can we not call the OzoneManager#getRatisSnapshotIndex() method here?
Yes. done
Instead of instantiating a new MetadataManagerImpl, can we not directly load the RocksDB and read the transactionInfo?

This is to make code simple, as anyway when using direct rocksdb also we need to open DB and read from the table. OMMetadataManager usage will be cleaner, and simpler to do.
As anyway, even if we open DB directly it opens all column families.
With skip Initialization of tables which is heavy part during initalization is skipped. And made this as internal config by not adding to ozone-default.xml
Added a config to use internally to skip initialization of tables. Rest most of the part is required for opening DB. This is done to make it simple and avoid less refactor.

Passing default config object should be trivial. Though this approach might make it simpler in terms of lines of code, it is not cleaner. I still don't see why OmMetadataMngr should be initialized just to read one value from the DB.
Even better would be to pass this value from the leader itself. But not sure how complicated that can get. Might have to pause Leader disk sync while sending the checkpoint.
Done. Removed extra config.

The exception caught here could be due to varied reasons. Can we have a more generic error message or have different try blocks. Also, if there is an exception, we should delete the downloaded checkpoint.
Done
Question: In case of some failure after OM is paused, should we unpause with the old DB?

Yes, this is an existing issue
I think you have opened a jira to address this issue
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HDDS-3741

This class seems redundant now. The getTermIndex() is only used in tests.
There are two options:

We can either update OMRatisSnapshotInfo on every DB flush when transactionInfo is updated to keep snapshotInfo in memory. But this update and DB update operation would need to be atomic and there is not mych used for it too.
The second option is to get rid of OMRatisSnapshotInfo and always read from DB for snapshotIndex.
This is needed during returning getLatestSnapshot in OMStateMachine.
getLatestSnapshot is used internally in Ratis during state reload. During reload or restart, getLastAppliedTermIndex would be 0,-1. The TransactionInfo stored in DB should be returned here instead.
This is already taken care during start and reload. We are setting the snapshotInfo from DB values. So, I think this should be fine here.

We should return the flushed TransactionInfo#logIndex here too. TransactionIndex returned via getLastAppliedIndex() might not have been flushed to DB yet. And logs could be purged upto this index. And if OM crashes before the transactions are flushed to disk by OMDoubleBuffer, there could be data loss.
Good catch. Done
On a newly setup OM, snapshotInfo is initialized to 0,-1 and so is LastAppliedTermIndex. This step is not required as it is setting the same values again.
Done
Typo: as {}
Done

Any reason for changing the naming convention here?
The new naming scheme would be <OM_Ratis_Dir>//om.db.
I think it would be more readable to have the timestamp at the end of file name instead of as a parent directory. What do you think?

Yes so that we can reuse OMMetadataManager code.
<OM_Ratis_Dir>//om.db
Can we revert this now that we don't need this to loadDB.
Still we need this. As We use DBStore.

Can we add a Info Log here. Something to say "Downloaded checkpoint with OMTransactionInfo - {}". This would help with debugging as the downloaded checkpoint's snapshotIndex is not logged in OMSnapshotProvider anymore.
Done
We can remove this comment now.
Yes removed

The lastAppliedIndex could have been updated between its assignment and the canProceed check. This check should be synchronous. Or at least the assignment should happen after reading the transactionInfo from DB.
Done.

nodes.bodyText:
Can we rename this method to something like loadSnapshotInfo or loadSnapshotInfoFromDB?
Also I think we should move the logic inside reinitialize() here and call this function from reinitialize(). It feels offbeat to call reinitialize() during initialization.
Done

We should return the flushed TransactionInfo#logIndex here too. TransactionIndex returned via getLastAppliedIndex() might not have been flushed to DB yet. And logs could be purged upto this index. And if OM crashes before the transactions are flushed to disk by OMDoubleBuffer, there could be data loss.

DBStore.flush() would not flush all the transactions in OMDoubleBuffer to disk, right?
Yes. It would not.
So this needs to be fixed then. Or could lead to data loss.
Why it will lead to data loss. We are returning already flushed index, and ratis only does log purge which have been flushed to DB.
So, that is the reason get lastAppliedIndex first, then flush. If we change the order, it will lead to data loss.
We should update the snapshotInfo also here.
Done

The lastAppliedIndex returned to Ratis and updated in snapshotInfo could be different. We should call getLastAppliedTermIndex() only once and set the same value in snapshotInfo which is being returned to ratis.
Done. Good catch.
